title: Wedding Typeface
content:
Can anyone tell me what gorge typeface is? Thank you!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120414232523im_/http:/typophile.com/files/invite_5192.jpg)
author: erinmccabe

comments.content:
What website did you find this at?

Mikey :-)

maybe Burgues script with a bit of modifications.

[http://www.sudtipos.com/fonts/97](http://web.archive.org/web/20120414232523/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/97 "http://www.sudtipos.com/fonts/97")

I think this is hand-drawn. The counters on the 'e's are all slightly different.

- Lex
that's only cos the photo is blur..you can't say for sure.. and considering it's embossed..it would have to be super tracing work on the handdrawn type.
Thanks for your help everyone! I found this invitation on the Ceci New York website.

Thank you Erin for telling us where you found this lovely card.

Very inspiration work. There are couple of scripts on the Ceci site that I would like identified for myself!

..... I don’t think its Burges... have a look at this PDF:  
 [http://www.veer.com/download/pdf/burguesscript.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20120414232523/http:/www.veer.com/download/pdf/burguesscript.pdf "http://www.veer.com/download/pdf/burguesscript.pdf")

Mikey :-)

Not Burgues or Compendium…

Must be a digital drawing that they made a plate of.
